reasoning: Extremely rare genetic disorder caused by SMAD4 gene mutations. Estimated prevalence 1 in 900,000 individuals (~0.11 per 100,000). Fewer than 1,000 cases reported in U.S., ~200 cases documented in global medical literature. Many cases likely undiagnosed or misdiagnosed.
source: NORD (National Organization for Rare Disorders), OMIM (Online Mendelian Inheritance in Man), NIH GARD (Genetic and Rare Diseases Information Center)
